meanings.definition: To deposit (an object) with a pawnbroker as security for money lent.
meanings.sent1: She was pawning her necklace to get some cash.
meanings.sent2: He is pawning his watch to borrow money.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought of pawning its toy mouse for treats.
meanings.sent4: The idea of pawning her favorite ring felt like giving away a piece of her heart.
meanings.sent5: Pawning items can help in times of financial need.

meanings.definition: The action of pawning an object.
meanings.sent1: His pawning of the guitar surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The pawning of jewelry is common in this area.
meanings.sent3: The pawning of the old vase turned into a family joke.
meanings.sent4: The pawning of memories can be bittersweet.
meanings.sent5: The art of pawning requires careful consideration.
